task_summary: Perceive the T-block and target, approach and align the tool, push the block along a straight direction until it matches the target pose, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a white planar surface until it aligns with a fixed target outline on the table. The robot first ensures both the block and the target are visible, then approaches above the block, aligns, sets a yaw suitable for pushing, and executes a straight push. After the push, the system checks if the block is at the target and retreats. The scene shows a single red T-block and a drawn target outline; the motion appears quasi-planar.
preconditions: Workspace clear on a flat surface
End-effector calibrated and safe speed limits set
Camera view available for visibility checks
stepwise_plan: Confirm visibility of T-block; if not, scan.
Confirm visibility of target region; if not, scan.
Move above the block at a safe height.
Approach and align to the push contact line with tight tolerance.
Set tool yaw for push direction.
Push the block toward the target along a straight line.
Verify arrival at the target region.
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps the target outline within visual tolerance
No loss of contact stability during push
failure_and_recovery: Block or target not visible → raster/grid scan and retry detection
Push under-travels → re-approach and issue a second push
Tool yaw misaligned → reset yaw and realign
Obstacle/contact anomaly → retreat and re-plan approach
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is detected at the target region and the robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector is aligned close to the stem of the T-block, indicating imminent push contact.
frame_3.predicts_next: A straight push actuation toward the target outline is expected.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T-block is visible.
Raster camera/EE scan to find the T-block.
Checks if the target region is visible.
Grid scan to locate the target outline.
Moves above the block at a safe vertical offset.
Fine approach to establish pushing alignment.
Sets the tool yaw to align push direction.
Executes a straight push toward the target.
Verifies that the block is at the target.

failure_modes: Perception drop-out hides either block or target
recovery_strategy: Fallback to scanning when visibility checks fail
Re-run SetTCPYaw and ApproachAndAlign if slip detected
Issue another Push after re-approach if IsAt fails
Retreat and re-scan workspace upon contact anomalies
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue outline target; instruction colors (gray/green/blue) differ. We bound to frame evidence.
Chosen push direction yaw=90° inferred from apparent target layout; exact world axes not provided.
Offset_z=0.04 m approximates safe clearance; not specified in the instruction.

expected_success_criteria: Final block pose overlaps target outline within tolerance
Robot maintains continuous contact during push
Safe retreat without re-contacting the block
